headline.title: Create QR code for event check-in

section-main.intro: The app now allows a check-in for events and locations. People who host events or have a business can now create a QR code. By scanning the QR code, guests can check in upon arrival to register their presence. If desired, the app will also create a corresponding diary entry. If a checked-in person later tests positive for the coronavirus, other people who were checked in at the same time can be warned.
section-main.introCLI: You can create QR codes in the app or here on this page. Alternatively, you can also use our official QR code utility to generate several QR codes at once, for example. Click here for a detailed guide on how to use the official QR code utility.
section-main.introMultiQR: The CSV file must follow the template as shown here in step 5. To get started use this sample file.
section-main.disclaimer: All information is processed only locally in your browser. Neither the QR codes you generate nor the information they contain are sent to the Corona-Warn-App servers. The source code of the generator is freely available for viewing.

errors.descriptionmax: The description can only have a maximum of 100 characters
errors.addressmax: The address can only have a maximum of 100 characters
errors.defaultcheckinlengthrequired: The typical length of stay is required
errors.defaultcheckinlengthnumber: The checkout time needs to be a number
errors.filerequired: You must import a CSV file
errors.wrongfileextension: The file extension is not valid. Only accepts .csv files
errors.wrongfileheaders: The headers of the .csv file do not correspond to the headers of the corresponding template, you can check it here
errors.wrongfileformatfields: Some field on your CSV is not filled correctly. Please check your .csv and try it again
